org.as2lib.ant
Class As2api

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectComponent
      org.apache.tools.ant.Task
          org.as2lib.ant.As2api

public class As2api
extends org.apache.tools.ant.Task

As2api generates HTML API documentation from ActionScript 2 source code with As2api.

Example: 

<as2api package="org.as2lib.*" classpath="${dist.dir}/src"
    outputDir="${docs.dir}/api" dotExe="dot.exe" drawDiagrams="yes"
    progress="yes" title="As2lib - Open Source ActionScript 2.0 Library"
    sources="yes"/>

This task can take the following arguments:

  • package (packages containing types to document)
  • outputDir (output directory to put generated html files into)
  • classpath (classpaths to search for packages)
  • title (title of the generated html pages)
  • progress (show generation progress?)
  • encoding (encoding of the source files to parse)
  • drawDiagrams (generate class/interface inheritance diagrams?)
  • dotExe (location of the "dot" tool from Graphviz)
  • sources (generate a html page for the source code of each input file?)
  • as2api (path to or name of the as2api executable)
  • help (show swfmill help?)

You must provide "package".

Since:
25.02.2006
Author:
Simon Wacker
See Also:
As2api, Apache Ant

Constructor Detail

As2api

Method Detail

setAs2api

public void setAs2api(java.lang.String as2api)
Sets the path to or name of the as2api executable.

The path can either be an absolute path: E:/Programming/Flash/as2api/as2api.exe

or a relative path: exe/as2api/as2api.exe

You may also just use the name of the executable (without the file extension) if the directory it resides in is included in the 'PATH' environment variable: as2api

If you do not set a as2api executable AS2API will be used. This requires that you include the directory in which the as2api executable resides in the 'PATH' environment variable.

Parameters:
as2api - the path to or name of the as2api executable

getAs2api

public java.lang.String getAs2api()
Returns the path to or name of the as2api executable.

If the as2api executable has not been set, the default executable name AS2API will be returned.

Returns:
the path to or name of the as2api executable

setOutputDir

public void setOutputDir(java.io.File outputDir)
Sets the directory into which generated HTML files shall be placed (the directory will be created if required). If no output directory is specified the default "apidocs" will be used.

Parameters:
outputDir - the directory to place the generated documentation into

setClasspath

public void setClasspath(org.apache.tools.ant.types.Path classpath)
Sets a list of paths, delimited by ';' or ':'. Each path will be searched for packages matching the given package list. If no classpath is specified, only the current directory is searched.

Parameters:
classpath - the classpaths to look-for packages in

setDotExe

public void setDotExe(java.io.File dotExe)
Specifies the location of the "dot" tool from Graphviz, if it is not available via the standard "PATH" environment variable.

Graphviz generates class/interface inheritance diagrams for each package.

See Also:

setDrawDiagrams

public void setDrawDiagrams(boolean drawDiagrams)
Shall class/interface inheritance diagrams be generated for each package? This requires that you have Graphviz.

You may specify the location of the "dot" tool from Graphviz, if it is not available via the standard "PATH" environment variable.

Parameters:
drawDiagrams -
See Also:
setDotExe(File), Graphviz

Are class/interface inheritance diagrams generated for each package?

See Also:

setEncoding

public void setEncoding(java.lang.String encoding)
Sets the encoding of the source files to be parsed.

Note that this must match the encoding of all input source files; no transcoding is performed. As2api cannot handle a mixture of file encodings in the set of source files to be proccessed.

getEncoding

public java.lang.String getEncoding()
Returns the encoding of the source files to be parsed.

See Also:
setEncoding(String)

setSources

public void setSources(boolean sources)
Shall a HTML page be generated for the source code of each input file?

Enables the inclusion of a copy of the source code of each documented type in the generated HTML. The source will be converted to an HTML file with syntax highlighting.

isSources

public boolean isSources()
See Also:
